definition: baton
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
stick/club/cudgel/smart/capable/strong/wonderful/classifier for legs of a relay race

sentences.english: The drum majorette twirled her baton.
sentences.chinese: 鼓樂隊女隊長快速地轉動她的指揮棒。

sentences.english: With his baton the conductor was beating time.
sentences.chinese: 指揮用指揮棒着打拍節。

sentences.english: I always wanted to be a baton twirler.
sentences.chinese: 我一直想要當一個耍指揮棒的指揮。

sentences.english: He pointed his baton behind him, then spun around to confront the violator. A sharp whistle.
sentences.chinese: 他指着他身後的指揮棒，轉過身來面對着違規者。

sentences.english: The drum majorette twirled her baton .
sentences.chinese: 鼓女快速轉動她指揮棒。

sentences.english: The college entrance examination "the music director stick" the serious influence class changed comprehensive implementation.
sentences.chinese: 高考的“指揮棒”嚴重影響了課改的全面實施。

sentences.english: He raises his baton and the symphony begins to play.
sentences.chinese: 他舉起指揮棒，交響樂開始演奏了。

definition: warp/line of longitude/meridian (geography)
to bridge/to put up a bridge
junior high school (Tw)/abbr. to 國中|国中[guo2 zhong1]
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
braided pigtail
small-scale/local/to a limited extent
striding forward with head high (idiom); to walk with spirited and vigorous step/to strut
hissing sound/to hiss (as a sign of displeasure)
to wave sth/to brandish
tight knot/intractable problem
pendulum
force feeding (as a teaching method)
a snap of the fingers (idiom); in an instant/in a short moment/in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
to cut ties/to disconnect/out of touch
military exercise/army drill
javelin
